verses.verse: Yet listen<WH8085> now,<WH3290> Jacob my servant,<WH5650> and Israel,<WH3478> whom I have chosen.<WH977>

This is what Yahweh<WH3068> who made<WH6213> you,<WH3335> and formed you from the womb,<WH990> who will help<WH5826> you says:<WH559> "Don't<WH3372> be afraid, Jacob<WH3290> my servant;<WH5650> and you,<WH3484> Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.<WH977>

For I will pour<WH3332> water<WH4325> on him who is thirsty,<WH6771> and streams<WH5140> on the dry ground.<WH3004> I will pour<WH3332> my Spirit<WH7307> on your seed,<WH2233> and my blessing<WH1293> on your offspring:<WH6631>
and they will spring up<WH6779> among<WH996> the grass,<WH2682> as willows<WH6155> by the<WH4325> watercourses.<WH2988>

One will say,<WH559> <WH3068> 'I am Yahweh's;' and another will be called<WH7121> by the name<WH8034> of Jacob;<WH3290> and another will write<WH3789> with his hand<WH3027><WH99999> 'to Yahweh,' and honor<WH3655> the name<WH8034> of Israel.<WH3478>"

This is what Yahweh,<WH3068> the King<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> and his Redeemer,<WH1350> Yahweh<WH3068> of Armies,<WH6635> says:<WH559> "I am the first,<WH7223> and I am the last;<WH314> and besides<WH1107> me there is no God.<WH430>

Who is like me?<WH7121> Who will call, and will declare<WH5046> it,<WH6186> and set it in order for me,<WH7760> since I established the ancient<WH5769> people?<WH5971> Let them declare<WH5046> the things that are coming,<WH935> and that will happen.<WH935>

Don't<WH6342> fear, neither be afraid.<WH7297> Haven't<WH5046> I declared it to you long<WH227> ago,<WH5046> and shown it?<WH5707> You are my witnesses. Is there<WH3426> a God<WH433> besides<WH1107> me?<WH3426> Indeed, there is not.<WH3045> I don't know any other Rock.<WH6697>"

Everyone who makes<WH3335> an engraved image<WH6459> is vain.<WH8414> The things<WH2530> that they delight in will not profit.<WH3276> Their own witnesses<WH5707> don't<WH7200> see, nor know,<WH3045> that they may be disappointed.<WH954>
Who has fashioned<WH3335> a god,<WH410> or molds<WH5258> an image<WH6459> that is profitable<WH3276> for nothing?<WH1115>

Behold,<WH2270> all his fellows will be disappointed;<WH954> and the workmen<WH2796> are mere men.<WH120> Let them all be gathered together.<WH6908> Let them stand up.<WH5975> They will fear.<WH6342> They will be put to shame<WH954> together.<WH3162>

The blacksmith<WH1270> takes an axe,<WH4621> works<WH6466> in the coals,<WH6352> fashions<WH3335> it with hammers,<WH4717> and works<WH6466> it with his strong<WH3581> arm.<WH2220> He is hungry,<WH7457> and his strength<WH3581> fails;<WH369> he drinks<WH8354> no water,<WH4325> and is faint.<WH3286>

The carpenter<WH2796> stretches out<WH5186> a line.<WH6957> He marks it out<WH8388> with a pencil.<WH8279> He shapes<WH6213> it with planes.<WH4741> He marks it out<WH8388> with compasses,<WH4230> and shapes<WH6213> it like the figure<WH8403> of a man,<WH376> with the beauty<WH8597> of a man,<WH120> to reside<WH3427> in a house.<WH1004>

He cuts down<WH3772> cedars<WH730> for himself,<WH3947> and takes the cypress<WH8645> and the oak,<WH437> and strengthens<WH553> for himself one among the trees<WH6086> of the forest.<WH3293> He plants<WH5193> a fir tree,<WH766> and the rain<WH1653> nourishes it.<WH1431>

Then it will be for a man<WH120> to burn;<WH1197> and he takes<WH3947> some of it,<WH2552> and warms himself.<WH1197> Yes, he burns it,<WH644> and bakes bread.<WH3899> Yes,<WH6466> he makes a god,<WH410> and worships<WH7812> it;<WH6213> he makes it an engraved image,<WH6459> and falls down to it.<WH5456>

He burns<WH8313> part<WH2677> of it in<WH1119> the fire.<WH784> With part<WH2677> of it,<WH398> he eats meat.<WH1320> He roasts<WH6748> a roast,<WH6740> and is satisfied.<WH7646> Yes,<WH2552> he warms himself,<WH559> and says, "Aha!<WH1889> I am warm.<WH2552> I have seen<WH7200> the fire.<WH217>"

The rest<WH7611> of it he makes<WH6213> into a god,<WH410> even his engraved image.<WH6459> He bows down<WH5456> to it and worships,<WH7812> and prays<WH6419> to it,<WH559> and says, "Deliver<WH5337> me;<WH410> for you are my god!"
They don't<WH3045> know, neither do they consider:<WH995> for he has shut<WH2902> their eyes,<WH5869> that they can't<WH7200> see; and their hearts,<WH3826> that they can't<WH7919> understand.

No one<WH3820> thinks,<WH7725> neither is there knowledge<WH1847> nor understanding<WH8394> to say,<WH559> "I have burned<WH8313> part<WH2677> of it in<WH1119> the fire.<WH784> Yes,<WH644> I have also baked bread<WH3899> on its coals.<WH1513> I have roasted<WH6740> meat<WH1320> and eaten<WH398> it.<WH6213> Shall I make the rest<WH3499> of it into an abomination?<WH8441> Shall I bow down<WH5456> to a tree<WH6086> trunk?<WH944>"

He feeds<WH7462> on ashes.<WH665> A deceived<WH2048> heart<WH3820> has turned him aside;<WH5186> and he can't<WH5337> deliver his soul,<WH5315> nor say,<WH559> "Isn't<WH8267> there a lie in my right hand?<WH3225>"

Remember<WH2142> these things,<WH3290> Jacob and Israel;<WH3478> for you are my servant.<WH5650> I have formed<WH3335> you.<WH5650> You are my servant. Israel,<WH3478> you will not be forgotten by me.<WH5382>
I have blotted out,<WH4229> as a thick cloud,<WH5645> your transgressions,<WH6588> and,<WH6051> as a cloud, your sins.<WH2403> Return<WH7725> to me,<WH1350> for I have redeemed you.

Sing,<WH7442> you heavens,<WH8064> for Yahweh<WH3068> has done<WH6213> it!<WH7321> Shout, you lower parts<WH8482> of the earth!<WH776> Break out<WH6476> into singing,<WH7440> you mountains,<WH2022> O forest,<WH3293> all of your trees,<WH6086> for Yahweh<WH3068> has redeemed<WH1350> Jacob,<WH3290> and will glorify<WH6286> himself in Israel.<WH3478>

Thus says<WH559> Yahweh,<WH3068> your Redeemer,<WH1350> and he who formed<WH3335> you from the womb:<WH990> "I am Yahweh,<WH3068> who makes<WH6213> all things;<WH5186> who alone stretches out the heavens;<WH8064> who spreads out<WH5186> the earth by myself;<WH776>

who frustrates<WH6565> the signs<WH226> of the liars,<WH907> and makes diviners<WH7080> mad;<WH1984> who turns<WH7725> wise<WH2450> men backward,<WH268> and makes their knowledge<WH1847> foolish;<WH5528>

who confirms<WH6965> the word<WH1697> of his servant,<WH5650> and performs<WH7999> the counsel<WH6098> of his messengers;<WH4397> who says<WH559> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> <WH3427> 'She will be inhabited;' and of the cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> <WH1129> 'They will be built,' and<WH6965> 'I will raise up its waste places;<WH2723>'
who says<WH559> to the deep,<WH6683> <WH2717> 'Be dry,' and<WH3001> 'I will dry up your rivers;<WH5104>'

Who says<WH559> of Cyrus,<WH3566> <WH7462> 'He is my shepherd, and shall perform<WH7999> all my pleasure,<WH2656>' even saying<WH559> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> <WH1129> 'She will be built;' and of the temple,<WH1964> <WH3245> 'Your foundation will be laid.'"
